bug.author: DarwinsBuddy
bug.summary: loading SVM model not supported in python
bug.description: I'm using OpenCV 3.0-beta and it seems that, according to my experience with the ml python module and various sites (e.g. <denchmark-link:http://answers.opencv.org/question/75077/opencv-300-python-svmload-is-missing/>http://answers.opencv.org/question/75077/opencv-300-python-svmload-is-missing/</denchmark-link> ), the possiblity to load a serialized and stored svm from disk is not properly wrapped in the python bindings. The issue could be related to <denchmark-link:https://github.com/opencv/opencv/issues/4969>#4969</denchmark-link> or even be the same. Is there someone currently working on this issue?

comments.comment: I wanted to provide a fix for this issue, but unfortunately the automatic build failed simply for differing ABI definitions. This is an intended solution, since I wrapped 2 functions for the python API. I'm new to contributing to this project. I appreciate anyone, who helps me out and shows me what documentation I haven't read to fix this issue.
Please do the same for ANN_MLP as it is affected by the same issue.
